item.title: [AAPL] Lenovo looking to partner with multiple AI models, CFO says
item.description: Lenovo is seeking partnerships with multiple large language models around the world to power its ​devices as it aims to establish itself as a global AI ‌player, the company's chief financial officer said. Lenovo, the world's largest personal computer maker, plans to equip its ‌broad range of products - from PCs to smartphones and wearables - with AI technology. "We are the only company besides Apple with significant market share across both ⁠PCs and mobiles, and in ‌the open Android and Windows ecosystems," Lenovo CFO Winston Cheng told Reuters on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in ‍Davos.

item.title: [PHNX.L] Aegon attracts bidders for $2.7bn UK insurance business
item.description: Since late last year, the Netherlands-based insurer has been reviewing options for its UK insurance and workplace business.

item.title: [AAPL] Apple and Dell supplier Pegatron expects US plant to be completed by end of March
item.description: TAIPEI, Jan 23 () - Taiwanese ​contract electronics ‌manufacturer Pegatron's first ‌U. factory is expected to be ⁠completed ‌by the end of ‍March, with trial production to ​begin around ‌then or April, President and CEO Kuang-Chih Cheng said ⁠on Friday.

item.title: [INTC] Stocks to Watch Friday: Intel, Capital One, CSX
item.description: ↘️ Intel (INTC): The chip maker swung to a bigger-than-expected loss and forecast more losses this quarter. It said it hadn’t adequately anticipated demand from AI data centers. Shares slid more than 12% in premarket trading.

item.title: [AAPL] Apple supplier Pegatron expects US plant to be completed by end-March
item.description: Taiwanese contract electronics manufacturer Pegatron's first U.S. factory, in Texas, is expected ​to be completed by the end of March, with ‌trial production to begin around then or April, President and CEO Kuang-Chih Cheng ‌said on Friday. The company, a supplier to Apple, Microsoft and Tesla, said in October it had acquired an industrial building and land in Texas, joining other Taiwanese tech manufacturers investing in the state ⁠including Foxconn, Inventec and ‌Wistron. "It is currently scheduled to be completed by the end of ​March, and we should be able to begin trial ‌production in late March or April."

item.title: [INTC] Intel Stock Falls After Loss Exceeds Forecasts
item.description: Intel (INTC) stock dropped offhours, after the chip maker swung to a larger-than-expected quarterly loss. Shares slid 13% in recent premarket trading. Intel forecast further losses to start 2026, as it spends heavily to ramp up production of its latest chips and contends with an inventory shortage.

item.title: [CRWD] The Age of AI Agents Brings a Risk No One Is Prepared For
item.description: Artificial-intelligence companies have promised that 2026 will be the year of agents: Software that can use AI language models to autonomously execute a complex series of tasks from simple instructions. The most prevalent use for agents today is for making software. With enough of a budget, a single developer can orchestrate teams of agents to work on existing codebases or even to start a project from scratch.

With no detailed commentary provided on what is driving this revision, you are left reading between the lines and weighing what it might signal about expectations for the business. item.title: [INTC] Intel Stock Sinks on Weak Outlook. CFO Says Chip Supply Will Improve Later This Year.
item.description: Intel stock fell sharply on Thursday after the chip maker offered disappointing guidance for its first-quarter revenue. The company reported adjusted earnings per share of 15 cents in the quarter versus Wall Street’s consensus estimate for 8 cents, according to FactSet. Intel shares fell as much as 10.9% following the company’s earnings release Thursday evening.

item.title: [INTC] Intel shares plunge on earnings expectations
item.description: Intel shares dove more than 10 percent Thursday despite the struggling US chip maker doing better than expected in the recently ended quarter, as its revenue forecast disappointed investors.While the depth of losses beat market expectations, Intel's revenue forecast for the current quarter fell far short of what Wall Street analysts were predicting amid recently raised expectations for the company.

item.title: [INTC] Intel Struggles to Meet Demand, CEO Says After Earnings
item.description: Intel Corp.&nbsp;gave a lackluster forecast for the current quarter because supply shortages are making it harder to meet customer demand. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan told Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow that demand is "quite strong." Ludlow reports on "Bloomberg The Close."

item.title: [AAPL] Apple's reported moves could mean John Ternus will be next CEO
item.description: Apple (AAPL) reportedly quietly expanded the role of the company's hardware chief John Ternus, who is seen as a top contender to succeed Apple CEO Tim Cook, according to reporting from Bloomberg. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton to take a closer look at what the report means for the iPhone maker and investors. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

item.title: [AAPL] US stocks rally again after Trump backs off Greenland tariff threat
item.description: Global stocks rallied Thursday, lifting US indices for a second straight day after President Donald Trump dialed back tariff threats on Europe over their opposition to a US takeover of Greenland.But relief came Wednesday when Trump backed down on threats to seize the Arctic island by force from ally Denmark and retracted his tariff threat.

item.title: [INTC] Intel: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
item.description: The average estimate of 16 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 8 cents per share. The world's largest chipmaker posted revenue of $13.67 billion in the period, which also beat Street forecasts. Fourteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $13.37 billion.

item.title: [AAPL] Apple Expands Hardware Chief’s Role in Latest Sign of CEO Candidacy
item.description: Cook, who has led Apple since 2011 and turned 65 in November, quietly tapped Ternus to manage the company’s design teams at the end of last year, according to people with knowledge of the matter. The responsibilities have special significance at Apple. The role was held by Jony Ive, Jobs’ longtime design partner, until his departure in 2019.
